titleStmt.title: Controlled vocabulary for places in MedCyprus project, both monuments (churches) and repositories (museums)

desc.desc: 1st layer: late 12th century (naos: north cross-arm, east wall)
2nd layer: 13th century (naos: north cross-arm, west, north and east wall; west cross-arm, north wall)
3rd layer: 14th century (naos: west cross-arm, south wall)
4th layer: second half of the 15th century (naos: west cross-arm, north wall)

place.desc: Anchorite cell and burial place; pilgrimage

desc.desc: 1st layer: 10th century (naos: north wall, above the tomb; north wall, eastern side). Some of the paintings have been removed to the
2nd layer: undetermined; prior to the 13th-14th century (naos: north wall, eastern side)
3rd layer: 13th-14th century? First half of the 14th century? (bema; naos: east, north and west wall; ceiling)

place.desc: Single-aisled vaulted church; later additions: south lateral aisle (12th-13th century?) and western open porch (14th-15th century?)

desc.desc: 1st layer: late 12th century (naos: south wall, western side; west wall)
2nd layer: 13th century? (naos: west wall; north wall, central recess?)

place.desc: Fragmentary. Some of the murals were illegally detached from the walls following 1974; current location unknown

desc.date: 11th century or early 12th century, with later additions

place.desc: Domed-hall church; domed-hall narthex subsequently added to the west (12th century)
Single-aisled barrel-vaulted church; narthex with drumless dome subsequently added to the west

desc.desc: 1st layer: early 13th century (naos: north and south wall)

place.desc: Partially preserved; after 1974, some murals mutilated, others detached. Conservation/cleaning: 1972 (DOAC), 2009 (USAID/SAVE)
Free-cross domed church; western crossarm subsequently extended westwards

desc.desc: 2nd layer: 15th century(?); overpainted in the 20th century (bema; central bay and dome; north and south crossarm

place.desc: Murals of 1st layer, very fragmentary. Conservation/cleaning: 1996, 1997 (DOAC)
Domed hall church; narthex subsequently added to the west (16th century)

desc.desc: first half of the 13th century (bema; naos)

place.desc: Domed-hall church, with a later extension to the west; built on the ruins of a 7th-century three-aisled basilica

desc.desc: 2nd layer: First half of the 16th century (bema, dome, naos)

place.desc: Badly damaged; very fragmentary. Conservation/cleaning: late 1940s, 1998, 2003, 2004, 2008, 2011, 2013-2015, 2017 (DOAC)
Domed-hall church (today, ruinous), with narthex subsequently added to the west (12th century)
Fragmentary; very poorly preserved. One mural detached and displayed in the
Domed-hall church, with twin apses inscribed into the eastern curved wall; narthex subsequently added to the west
Domed-hall(?)church, with south chapel added subsequently
Fragmentary; murals detached, now displayed in the . Conservation/cleaning: 1992, 2001 (DOAC)
Single-cell chapel, partially carved into the rock (built sections of north, south and west walls do not survive)
Free-cross domed church; western extension of aisles, narthex, and northeastern naos compartment added subsequently (13th century?)

desc.desc: 2nd layer: Early 13th century (naos: north and south crossarms)
4th layer: 15th century (naos: dome, north and south crossarms, western vault)

place.desc: Five-domed basilica, with a small domed tetraconch attached to its southeast corner; narthex subsequently added to the west (19th century)

desc.desc: 1st layer: 8th or 9th century(eastern dome above bema)
5th layer: Late 15th - Early 16th century(bema; central and western domes of nave; nave)

place.placeName: Gialia, Monastery of Panagia Chrysogialiotissa, katholikon
Gialia, Monastery of Panagia Chrysogialiotissa, Saint George chapel
Γιαλιά, Παναγία Χρυσογιαλιώτισσα, παρεκκλήσιο Αγίου Γεωργίου
Kakopetria, Saint Nicholas of the Roof
Kalopanagiotis, Monastery of Saint John Lampadistes, chapel of Saint John Lampadistes
Kalopanagiotes, Monastery of Saint John Lampadistes, chapel of Saint John Lampadistes
Kalopanagiotis, Monastery of Saint John Lampadistes, katholikon of Saint Herakleidios
Kalopanagiotes, Monastery of Saint John Lampadistes, katholikon of Saint Herakleidios

desc.date: Prior to the late 12th century (date of 1st layer of painted decoration)

place.desc: Chamber of a Hellenestic(?) rock-cut tomb, converted into a chapel

place.placeName: Koutsoventis, Monastery of St John Chrysostom, Holy Trinity chapel
Koutsovendes, Monastery of Saint John Chrysostom, Holy Trinity chapel
Κουτσοβέντης, Μοναστήρι Αγίου Ιωάννη Χρυσοστόμου, Παρεκκλήσιο Αγίας Τριάδος
Bishopric of Kyrenia, Dependency (metochi) of the Patriarchate of Jerusalem.
Koutsoventis, Monastery of Saint John Chrysostom, Panagia Aphendrika
Koutsovendes, Monastery of Saint John Chrysostom, Panagia Aphendrika
Koutsoventis, Monastery of Saint John Chrysostom, Saviour
Koutsovendes, Monastery of Saint John Chrysostom, Saviour
Lagoudera, Panagia tou Araka or Arakiotissa
Λαγουδερά, Παναγία τοῦ Ἄρακος ή Ἀρακιώτισσα
place.desc: Domed-hall structure, with an early 12th-13th c. narthex covered both with a large timber roof

desc.desc: 4th layer: First half 17th century (external north wall)

place.desc: 1st layer: Theodore Apseudes (?) or "Painter of Apseudes" 2nd layer: "Painter of Leo" 3rd layer: Leontios the Deacon

place.placeName: Monagri, Monastery of Panagia Amasgou, katholikon

place.desc: Single-aisled timber-roofed church with an L-shaped closed portico on its northern and western side.

desc.desc: 2nd layer: Early 14th century (nave: Presentation of Christ in the Temple, gallery: external west wall)
3rd layer: Late 15th - Early 16th century (gallery: external side of the northern wall)

place.desc: Ioannes Gerakiotes and his wife Irene

place.placeName: Νικητάρι, Παναγία ἡ Φορβιώτισσα ή τὴς Ἀσίνου
place.desc: Single barrel-vaulted church with a second timber gable roof and narthex

desc.desc: 2nd layer: Second half of the 12th century (narthex: south conch: Saint George)
3rd layer: Late 13th century (bema, nave, narthex: south conch: semidome, semicylindrical wall: St. Anastasia Pharmakolytria with the donor Anastasia Saramalina )
5th layer: First half of the 17th century (Christ Emmanuel: now in bema)
3rd layer: first half of 14th century (bema [now in south apse], nave)
4th layer: 3rd quarter of the 14th century (north aisle)
5th layer: 15th century (west wall of the south aisle)

place.placeName: Sichari, Monastery of Panagia Apsinthiotissa, katholikon
Sychari, Monastery of Panagia Apsinthiotissa, katholikon
Sichari, Monastery of Panagia Apsinthiotissa, refectory
Sychari, Monastery of Panagia Apsinthiotissa, refectory

place.desc: Single-aisled cross-in-square church with dome, on the ruins of an early Christian basilica

desc.desc: 3rd layer: Last third 13th century (bema [prothesis: disk with asterisk], naos)
4th layer: 16th century (bema [prothesis: figure in/and the chalice], naos: northeastern small recess)

place.desc: Rock-cut hermitage in three consecutive caves: nave, bema, cell-tomb

desc.desc: 2nd layer: 1196 or ca. 1200 or <1214 (bema, naos, refectory)

place.placeName: Byzantine Museum of the Cultural Foundation Archbishop Makarios III
Βυζαντινό Μουσείο Πολιτιστικού Ιδρύματος Αρχιεπισκόπου Μακαρίου Γ'
Ecclesiastical Museum of the Holy Bishopric of Paphos
